remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided remaining yaw damper is verified to be operative.

placard.para: Placard affected Yaw Damper switchlight "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To verify the proper operation of the remaining yaw damper use the following procedure:
Establish electrical and hydraulic power.
Verify that the IRS' are aligned and in NAV mode.
Position autopilot and flight director switches to OFF on AFDS mode control panel P55.
Verify that Engine Indicating and Crew Alerting System is operational.
Select STATUS on EICAS display select panel P9.
Press operational YAW DAMPER switchlight on yaw damper panel and verify ON is illuminated.
Verify that YAW DAMPER INOP indicator is extinguished.
Momentarily position YAW DMPR test switch (P61) to TEST on the operational yaw damper (L or R).
Verify immediately that the YAW DAMPER INOP indicator is illuminated amber.

Verify that the rudder position indicator in EICAS display shows the rudder moves approximately 3 degrees trailing edge right, then 3 degrees trailing edge left and then returns to center within 10 SECONDS. Rudder deflection of 3 degrees is represented by a 0.05 inch movement on the EICAS indicator scale.
Verify that the YAW DAMPER INOP indicator is extinguished in approximately 10 seconds.
Restore aircraft to required configuration.

note.para: Use step 2 below to render L or R Yaw Damper System inoperative ONLY if there is visible external leakage evident at the L or R Yaw Damper Actuator.

numlitem.para: To render L or R Yaw Damper System Inoperative:
For left yaw damper actuator, remove left hydraulic system pressure. For right yaw damper actuator, remove center hydraulic system pressure.
At the P-61 panel, select the L, C, R, TAIL SHUTOFF VALVES to OFF position.
At the P-10 control stand, select the two STAB TRIM switches to CUTOFF position.
Open the following circuit breakers at the P-11 panel. Make sure the FLT CONT ELEC AC circuit breakers are opened prior to the FLT CONT ELEC DC circuit breakers for each power supply module.

entry.para: FLT CONTROL SHUTOFF TAIL L (H17), C (H18), R (H28)

numlitem.para: Gain access to the leaky yaw damper actuator.
Remove the pressure and return lines from the leaky actuator.

note.para: Use suitable caps and plugs, such as MS21913K4 (plug) and MS21914-4K (cap) or equivalent for pressure lines and MS21913D6 (plug) and MS21914-6D (cap) or equivalent for return lines.

numlitem.para: Cap actuator hydraulic port.
Plug actuator hydraulic line.
Close all circuit breakers opened in step D.
Set STAB TRIM switches at the P-10 control stand to NORM.
Set L, C, R, TAIL SHUTOFF VALVES to ON.
Verify proper operation of the remaining yaw damper system per step 1 above.
